alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 4:10PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Lauderhill, Oakland Park, Lauderdale Lakes, Dania Beach, St. George, Broadview Park, Melrose Park, Washington Park, Golden Heights, Sawgrass Mills Mall, Franklin Park, Chula Vista, Twin Lakes and Broward Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
